article.headline: St. Louis 64, Fordham 54
article.story: ST. LOUIS (AP) -- Kevin Lisch scored 15 of his 18 points in the second half and Ian Vouyoukas also had a strong finish, helping Saint Louis recover from a slow start to beat Fordham 64-54 on Saturday night. Lisch hit six straight free throws in the final minute to help Saint Louis continue a pattern of alternating wins and losses for the 21st consecutive game dating to the end of last season. The Billikens (10-9, 4-3 Atlantic 10) spotted Fordham the first 10 points before rebounding from a 29 percent, 39-point effort in a 15-point loss to Saint Joseph's on Wednesday. Vouyoukas had 16 points and seven rebounds despite foul trouble in the second half and Tommie Liddell also had 16 points for Saint Louis. Jermaine Anderson had 20 points, including four 3-pointers, and Bryant Dunston added 12 points, eight rebounds and three blocks for Fordham (8-11, 3-3). The Rams, the best 3-point shooting team in the conference at 39 percent, were 9-for-19 from long range. Lisch scored seven of his points in a 9-0 run to start the second half that gave Saint Louis its first lead at 31-28 with 14:59 to go. The go-ahead basket was a 3-pointer from a few steps beyond the arc with the shot clock running out. Fordham regained the lead behind a nine-point flurry from Anderson in a span of just over three minutes that put the Rams ahead 39-35 with 10:44 to go. Vouyoukas, held to a season-worst five points against Saint Joseph's, had a pair of dunks down the stretch. Two 3-pointers by Anderson fueled a fast start for Fordham, which led 10-0 after 3:40. Saint Louis had three turnovers, two by Vouyoukas, and a Vouyoukas shot that was blocked by Dunston in its first four possessions. Vouyoukas, who didn't get his first basket until the final three minutes of Saint Louis' 54-39 loss to Saint Joseph's on Wednesday, was scoreless against Fordham until making a layup with 4:17 left in the first half.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
